name: Jungian Psychology and Tantric Buddhism
description: Jung wrote extensively on the benefits of Buddhism to personal development and transformation. This course explores the contribution of Jungian psychology to understanding Tantric (or Vajrayana) Buddhism. Through experiential exercises, students will investigate the role of archetypal psychology as a mediator of the spiritual transformation described in Tantric Buddhism.
exclusions: NEW433H1 Advanced Special Topics: Psychology of Tantric Buddhism
